p: There was a total of 144 rural cases reported, with significant differences in the proportion among the five waves ( χ 2 = 73.361, P<0.001). In total, 10, 24, 21, 24 and 65 rural cases were found in each wave, with a significant trend ( χ 2 = 70.328, P<0.001) identified showing a growing proportion of rural cases. The proportion in the fifth wave was significantly different from that in the first, the second and the third wave ( χ 2 = 41.811, 53.697, 16.047, P<0.001, P<0.001, P<0.001, respectively), but similar to the fourth wave ( χ 2 = 1.584, P = 0.208). All the above results were shown in Table 1.
